listitem.para: Whetherpluto will turn into a daemon by forking in the background, or whether it will remain on the foreground. Valid options are yes (the default) or no. Older init systems, such as sysv initscripts, require that pluto forks into the background. Newer init systems, such as systemd or upstart prefer the process remains in the foreground. The current default reflects the fact that most systems are still based on sysv init scripts. Init systems can override this configuration option by starting pluto specifically with --nofork specified on the command line to start the pluto daemon after specifying the --config /etc/ipsec.conf option.
